verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>,
Should a wise man <S%H2450><s%> make answer <S%H6030><s%> with vain <S%H7307><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, And fill <S%H4390><s%> himself <S%H990><s%> with the east wind <S%H6921><s%>?
Should he reason <S%H3198><s%> with unprofitable <S%H5532><s%> talk <S%H1697><s%>, Or with speeches <S%H4405><s%> wherewith he can do no good <S%H3276><s%>?
Yea <S%H6565><s%>, thou doest away with fear <S%H3374><s%>, And hinderest <S%H1639><s%> devotion <S%H7881><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H410><s%>.
For thine iniquity <S%H5771><s%> teacheth <S%H502><s%> thy mouth <S%H6310><s%>, And thou choosest <S%H977><s%> the tongue <S%H3956><s%> of the crafty <S%H6175><s%>.
Thine own mouth <S%H6310><s%> condemneth <S%H7561><s%> thee <S%H8193><s%>, and not I; Yea, thine own lips testify against thee <S%H6030><s%>.
Art thou the first <S%H7223><s%> man <S%H120><s%> that was born <S%H3205><s%>? Or wast thou brought <S%H2342><s%> forth before <S%H6440><s%> the hills <S%H1389><s%>?
Hast thou heard <S%H8085><s%> the secret <S%H5475><s%> counsel of God <S%H433><s%>? And dost thou limit <S%H1639><s%> wisdom to thyself <S%H2451><s%>?
What knowest <S%H3045><s%> thou <S%H3045><s%>, that we know not <S%H995><s%>? What understandest thou, which is not in us?
With us are both the gray-headed <S%H7867><s%> and the very aged <S%H3453><s%> men <S%H3524><s%>, Much elder <S%H3117><s%> than thy father <S%H1><s%>.
Are the consolations <S%H8575><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> too small <S%H4592><s%> for thee <S%H1697><s%>, Even the word that is gentle toward thee <S%H328><s%>?
Why doth thy heart <S%H3820><s%> carry thee away <S%H3947><s%>? And why do thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> flash <S%H7335><s%>,
That against God <S%H410><s%> thou turnest <S%H7725><s%> thy spirit <S%H7307><s%>, And lettest words <S%H4405><s%> go out <S%H3318><s%> of thy mouth <S%H6310><s%>?
What is man <S%H582><s%>, that he should be clean <S%H2135><s%>? And he that is born <S%H3205><s%> of a woman <S%H802><s%>, that he should be righteous <S%H6663><s%>?
Behold <S%H539><s%>, he putteth no trust in his holy <S%H6918><s%> ones <S%H8064><s%>; Yea, the heavens are not clean <S%H2141><s%> in his sight <S%H5869><s%>:
How much less one <S%H376><s%> that is abominable <S%H8581><s%> and corrupt <S%H376><s%>, A man that drinketh <S%H8354><s%> iniquity <S%H5766><s%> like water <S%H4325><s%>!
I will show <S%H2331><s%> thee <S%H8085><s%>, hear thou me <S%H2372><s%>; And that which I have seen I will declare <S%H5608><s%>:
(Which wise <S%H2450><s%> men have told <S%H5046><s%> From their fathers <S%H1><s%>, and have not hid it <S%H3582><s%>;
Unto whom alone the land <S%H776><s%> was given <S%H5414><s%>, And no stranger <S%H2114><s%> passed <S%H5674><s%> among them <S%H8432><s%>):

The wicked <S%H7563><s%> man travaileth <S%H2342><s%> with pain all his days <S%H3117><s%>, Even the number <S%H4557><s%> of years <S%H8141><s%> that are laid <S%H6845><s%> up for the oppressor <S%H6184><s%>.
A sound <S%H6963><s%> of terrors <S%H6343><s%> is in his ears <S%H241><s%>; In prosperity <S%H7965><s%> the destroyer <S%H7703><s%> shall come upon him <S%H935><s%>.
He believeth <S%H539><s%> not that he shall return <S%H7725><s%> out of darkness <S%H2822><s%>, And he is waited <S%H6822><s%> for of the sword <S%H2719><s%>.

He wandereth abroad <S%H5074><s%> for bread <S%H3899><s%>, saying <S%H3045><s%>, Where is it? He knoweth that the day <S%H3117><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> is ready <S%H3559><s%> at his hand <S%H3027><s%>.
Distress <S%H6862><s%> and anguish <S%H4691><s%> make him afraid <S%H1204><s%>; They prevail <S%H8630><s%> against him <S%H4428><s%>, as a king ready <S%H6264><s%> to the battle <S%H3593><s%>.
Because he hath stretched out <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> against God <S%H410><s%>, And behaveth himself proudly <S%H1396><s%> against the Almighty <S%H7706><s%>;
He runneth <S%H7323><s%> upon him with a stiff neck <S%H6677><s%>, With the thick <S%H5672><s%> bosses <S%H1354><s%> of his bucklers <S%H4043><s%>;
Because he hath covered <S%H3680><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> with his fatness <S%H2459><s%>, And gathered <S%H6213><s%> fat <S%H6371><s%> upon his loins <S%H3689><s%>;

And he hath dwelt <S%H7931><s%> in desolate <S%H3582><s%> cities <S%H5892><s%>, In houses <S%H1004><s%> which no man inhabited <S%H3427><s%>, Which were ready <S%H6257><s%> to become heaps <S%H1530><s%>;

He shall not be rich <S%H6238><s%>, neither shall his substance <S%H2428><s%> continue <S%H6965><s%>, Neither shall their possessions <S%H5186><s%> be extended <S%H4512><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%>.

He shall not depart <S%H5493><s%> out of darkness <S%H2822><s%>; The flame <S%H7957><s%> shall dry up <S%H3001><s%> his branches <S%H3127><s%>, And by the breath <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H6310><s%>'s mouth shall he go away <S%H5493><s%>.
Let him not trust <S%H539><s%> in vanity <S%H7723><s%>, deceiving <S%H8582><s%> himself <S%H7723><s%>; For vanity shall be his recompense <S%H8545><s%>.
It shall be accomplished <S%H4390><s%> before <S%H3808><s%> his time <S%H3117><s%>, And his branch <S%H3712><s%> shall not be green <S%H7488><s%>.
He shall shake off <S%H2554><s%> his unripe grape <S%H1154><s%> as the vine <S%H1612><s%>, And shall cast off <S%H7993><s%> his flower <S%H5328><s%> as the olive-tree <S%H2132><s%>.
For the company <S%H5712><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%> shall be barren <S%H1565><s%>, And fire <S%H784><s%> shall consume <S%H398><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of bribery <S%H7810><s%>.
They conceive <S%H2029><s%> mischief <S%H5999><s%>, and bring forth <S%H3205><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%>, And their heart <S%H990><s%> prepareth <S%H3559><s%> deceit <S%H4820><s%>.
